prompt.content:
Imagine you are playing the game as Joshua.

Here is the description of the game: This game is called Werewolves (also known as Mafia), which is a social deduction game.  GAME STRUCTURE: This game contains six players: two villagers, two werewolves, one seer, and one witch. Each cycle consists of Night phases followed by Day phases. WIN CONDITIONS: Villagers win by eliminating all Werewolves. Werewolves win when they equal or outnumber the Villagers. NIGHT PHASES: (1) Werewolves wake and privately choose one Villager to kill using 'kill NAME'. (2) The Seer wakes and inspects one player using 'inspect NAME' to learn if they are a Werewolf or Villager. (3) The Witch wakes and may use their one-time save potion with 'save NAME' (if someone died tonight) or their one-time poison potion with 'poison NAME' to kill someone. DAY PHASES: (1) Dawn: All players learn who died during the night (if any). (2) Discussion: All living players go *one* round of public discussion to discuss and debate who might be a Werewolf. Use 'speak' to share your thoughts and suspicions. (3) Voting: Each player votes to eliminate one suspected Werewolf using 'vote NAME'. The player with the most votes is executed. (4) Twilight: The execution result is announced and night returns. COMMUNICATION RULES: All day discussions are public. Dead players cannot speak or act. If 'action' is available, use commands like 'kill NAME', 'inspect NAME', 'save NAME', 'poison NAME', or 'vote NAME'. Note: Player actions in the nights are not seen by players of other roles (e.g. only wolves can see other wolves' actions). Day discussion is public. Voting requires an 'action' beginning with 'vote'.

The players in this game are: Nancy, Joshua, Justin, Jennifer, Lisa, Mark, and during the day, they speak in the same order as they are listed.

Your (Joshua's) goal: Deceive others, avoid detection, and eliminate villagers.

{secret}

prompt.content:
Imagine you are playing the game as Joshua.

Here is the description of the game: This game is called Werewolves (also known as Mafia), which is a social deduction game.  GAME STRUCTURE: This game contains six players: two villagers, two werewolves, one seer, and one witch. Each cycle consists of Night phases followed by Day phases. WIN CONDITIONS: Villagers win by eliminating all Werewolves. Werewolves win when they equal or outnumber the Villagers. NIGHT PHASES: (1) Werewolves wake and privately choose one Villager to kill using 'kill NAME'. (2) The Seer wakes and inspects one player using 'inspect NAME' to learn if they are a Werewolf or Villager. (3) The Witch wakes and may use their one-time save potion with 'save NAME' (if someone died tonight) or their one-time poison potion with 'poison NAME' to kill someone. DAY PHASES: (1) Dawn: All players learn who died during the night (if any). (2) Discussion: All living players go *one* round of public discussion to discuss and debate who might be a Werewolf. Use 'speak' to share your thoughts and suspicions. (3) Voting: Each player votes to eliminate one suspected Werewolf using 'vote NAME'. The player with the most votes is executed. (4) Twilight: The execution result is announced and night returns. COMMUNICATION RULES: All day discussions are public. Dead players cannot speak or act. If 'action' is available, use commands like 'kill NAME', 'inspect NAME', 'save NAME', 'poison NAME', or 'vote NAME'. Note: Player actions in the nights are not seen by players of other roles (e.g. only wolves can see other wolves' actions). Day discussion is public. Voting requires an 'action' beginning with 'vote'.

The players in this game are: Nancy, Joshua, Justin, Jennifer, Lisa, Mark, and during the day, they speak in the same order as they are listed.

Your (Joshua's) goal: Deceive others, avoid detection, and eliminate villagers.

{secret}

Here is the context of the interaction:


Conversation Starts:

Turn #0: [Game] State: Night_werewolf. The game begins!
Joshua: [action] kill Nancy

Turn #1: Jennifer: [action] kill Justin
[Game] Entering state: Night_seer

Turn #2: [Game] Entering state: Night_witch

Turn #3: [Game] Nancy was killed by werewolves!
[Game] Entering state: Day_discussion

Turn #4: Joshua: said: "Nancy was killed by the werewolves, but I don't think it was me. Justin is dead too—wait, Jennifer killed Justin? That’s suspicious. Why would she target him right after Nancy? Maybe she's trying to frame someone. I think Jennifer is the werewolf—she acted too fast."

Turn #5: Justin: said: "I think we should seriously consider Joshua's point about Jennifer. Jumping to conclusions might be a mistake, but we cannot ignore her actions. However, we also need to think about Nancy's death. She was a villager, and her loss reveals more about our suspicions. We need to be careful with our votes today."

Turn #6: Jennifer: said: "Joshua, you’re trying to shift blame by pointing at me because I killed Justin—but why would I kill a fellow villager? You’re the one who killed Nancy first. If you weren’t a werewolf, why target her? I think YOU’RE the real threat. Don’t distract us with false accusations—I’m trying to help this village survive."

Turn #7: Lisa: said: ""I think we need to focus on the facts before jumping to conclusions. Joshua is right to be suspicious of Jennifer, but we shouldn't dismiss her defense either. We lost Nancy, a villager—let's take a moment to evaluate our next moves wisely. I suggest we consider voting out anyone who is acting overly defensive or aggressive, as that could be a tell. I’m not sure who to vote for just yet, but let’s keep our eyes open to all possibilities.”"

Turn #8: Mark: said: "I hear everyone's concerns, and I agree we should proceed cautiously. Jennifer, I understand your defense, but the speed at which Joshua suspects you is concerning as well. We need to consider all evidence before making a vote. I suggest we discuss everyone's actions more and share any suspicions beyond just the immediate conflict."
[Game] Entering state: Day_vote


Your available action type(s): [action].
It is voting time. You MUST use the command 'vote NAME' to vote for a player to eliminate. e.g. 'vote Alice'

GAME STRUCTURE: This game contains six players: two villagers, two werewolves, one seer, and one witch. Each cycle consists of Night phases followed by Day phases. WIN CONDITIONS: Villagers win by eliminating all Werewolves. Werewolves win when they equal or outnumber the Villagers. NIGHT PHASES: (1) Werewolves wake and privately choose one Villager to kill using 'kill NAME'. (2) The Seer wakes and inspects one player using 'inspect NAME' to learn if they are a Werewolf or Villager. (3) The Witch wakes and may use their one-time save potion with 'save NAME' (if someone died tonight) or their one-time poison potion with 'poison NAME' to kill someone. DAY PHASES: (1) Dawn: All players learn who died during the night (if any). (2) Discussion: All living players go *one* round of public discussion to discuss and debate who might be a Werewolf. Use 'speak' to share your thoughts and suspicions. (3) Voting: Each player votes to eliminate one suspected Werewolf using 'vote NAME'. The player with the most votes is executed. (4) Twilight: The execution result is announced and night returns. COMMUNICATION RULES: All day discussions are public. Dead players cannot speak or act. If 'action' is available, use commands like 'kill NAME', 'inspect NAME', 'save NAME', 'poison NAME', or 'vote NAME'.
